Description: Rim fragment ("sofa rim") of North Ionian pottery plate; exterior glazed brown; interior, cream slip: guilloche with palmettes in interstices; inner lines of guilloche red.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

From the same plate as Boston, MFA 88.825, 88.841 and 88.966 (see Walter-Karydi, Samos VI.1, 1973, 139 no. 731, pl. 97.731, erroneously classified as Chian). Özer 2004, 200, classifies the plate as transitional between LWG and black-figure and dates it to 570-60BC. Özer, B. 2004, ‘Clazomenian and related black-figured pottery from Klazomenai: preliminary observations’, in A.Moustaka,E.Skarlatidou, M.-C.Tzannes,Y.Ersoy (Eds), Klazomenai, Teos and Abdera:Metropoleis and Colony,Thessaloniki, 199–219.Özer, B. 2004, ‘Clazomenian and related black-figured pottery from Klazomenai: preliminary observations’, in A. Moustaka, E. Skarlatidou, M.-C. Tzannes,Y. Ersoy (eds), Klazomenai, Teos and Abdera: Metropoleis and Colony,Thessaloniki, 199–219.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IId pl. 4, 23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.731)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.668, table 8.8) (no.13 or 14?)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
